snippet: As big banks leave the money-transfer business, other secure, low-cost options must be found to ensure that migrants’ hard-earned money reaches their families.
abstract: Editorial laments news that big banks are leaving money transfer business, arguably most effective antipoverty effort in the world for migrants working in rich countries who regularly transfer money home; calls for other low-cost options for cash transfers, including possibility of making World Bank a remittance center.
lead_paragraph: As big banks leave the money-transfer business, other secure, low-cost options must be found to ensure that migrants’ hard-earned money reaches their families.
